speaker: Viral image
vclaim: The scarecrow discovered on the Texas farm was actually a human skeleton.
date: stated on August 26, 2019 in a Facebook post:
title: No, this scarecrow isn't a human skeleton.
text: Of course, only in early September, but super Halloween stores are already moving to strip shops and Facebook users share a scary story on the Internet. "In the early 2000s, a man bought a farm in Texas," reading August 26 (a warning, an disturbing picture). Notice a scarecrow in the middle of his land. He went to her and smelled something rotten. He took the clothes from the scarecrow and found out it was a human skeleton. This is the picture he took before the authorities arrived. This article was referred to as part of Facebook's efforts to combat false news and misleading information in its news broadcast. ∙ (Read more about our partnership with Facebook.) The image in the mail is hideous, showing what looks like a dry object hanging on branches like a scarecrow. And, well, it's scarecrow. The photo is taken from a blog called Pete Maru, which contains recent articles with titles such as "The Crowded Sled" and "Halloween 2013." The distinguished fact-finding bloggers mentioned on January 10, 2021 in the story of "The Rebel Law - General Flynn will be appointed Vice-President." By Samantha Buterman: January 11, 2021 in March 2012, an article entitled "Skeleton Country" presented the picture in Facebook, among other angles of the scarecrow. The article was marked with two signs - pillars and conflicts - and the person who published the picture under the name "Maru" responded to some commentators who expressed admiration for his manual work. "That's great," someone wrote. "It's kind of how I wish my scarecrow looked." Your autopsy looks great too." "Thank you so much!" (Maru) Answered. "He was originally going to have a cardboard box on his head... but he seemed weird and embarrassed so I went with a rough bag." Maru later wrote in his comments that he took pictures on an abandoned farm outside Wellington, New Zealand. In a part of the Internet Forum entitled Halloween called "The Building for Support and Education," Maru said that the body of the scarecrow was "built from scratch" using newspapers and masked tape. We're assessing this wrong Facebook post.
